description: Fixed version with proper signature verification using ecrecover
root_cause:
The withdraw function accepts signatures but does not verify them. It only checks the signature count without validating that signatures are from registered validators using ecrecover.

Key Weaknesses: Insufficient validator key security; Weak on-chain signature verification; Low multi-sig threshold (5/7)
attack_scenario:
Attackers gained access to 5 out of 7 validator keys and created valid ECDSA signatures for fake withdrawal transactions

Attack Flow: Attackers compromise 5 of 7 validator private keys through phishing or malware → Create fraudulent withdrawal transactions claiming deposits on Orbit Chain → Generate valid ECDSA signatures using compromised validator keys → Call withdraw() with forged but cryptographically valid signatures → Bridge validates signature count (5 >= threshold) and processes withdrawal → Drain $81M across WBTC, ETH, USDT, USDC, and other tokens
fix_description: Implement hardware security modules (HSMs) for validator keys; Use multi-party computation (MPC) for distributed key management; Increase multi-sig threshold (e.g., 7-of-10)
